Birthday fatigue relief?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Birthday fatigue relief?
By Corpse on Thursday, July 18, 2002 - 02:05 pm:

After a two-month hiatus from the MR world, I decided to jump back into MR3, deciding on a Eega. As I was playing the Eega through, I noticed a small, minor detail that I thought might be of some small interest. The week prior to his first birthday, he was just coming off a sucessful venture, leaving him 'very refreshed' and stress-free. I did a Life Risk drill with him, having all the best durables in my inventory.

My Eega (Biagio) did the drill, which should of left Biagio 'seems healthy' (at least the drill has done this with previous monsters of mine) entering his birthday. But after the birthday song, Biagio was 'healthy', as if he only did one of those small arrow life drills.

I don't know if the birthday had anything to do with it, but if it did, the fatigue relief isn't that great as it only happens once a year. But it's something I thought I'd point out to see what people thought or knew of it.

By torey luvullo on Thursday, July 18, 2002 - 04:06 pm:

wb, corpse! i've seen the birthday song relieve fatigue, and i have indirect evidence that it relieves some stress as well. not in all monsters, but in some.

By The D on Thursday, July 18, 2002 - 04:17 pm:

Yeah, the way I usually train my monsters at around 2nd stage on, is rest after 2 weeks of drilling. Now sometimes, after a drill, fleria tells me that he's healthy, but then also drops from there to little tired. But just to say, it differs on what fleria says, sometimes "Is Healthy" and sometimes "Looks Healthy", but since it all ends up at "Seems tired" I think its all the same.

I hav'nt really payed attention to the birthday, and how it relieves your monster, but it does say that just during regular Hard Drilling.
